TopicTitle: Professor Boone's journey to Blue Heaven [Story Idea/Something Fun]

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone, I am Professor Boone.

I have played Kerbal Space Program a few times, and watched enough YouTube to find myself wanting to play this game and due something different for myself.

I recently started taking a more of a role-play view towards this game, trying to make the experience more personal. I have thus, created the avatar of Professor Boone, a Kermin wanting to reach the "Blue Heaven". I started by doing an odd "Narrator thing" just to myself while playing. Like I'm reading a story to myself. I than found myself naming rockets for missions, and purposes. Soon, the names started to have meanings. Much like I designed a rocket with the soul purpose of just getting out of Kerbin's atmosphere, and naming it Blue Heaven Mk1.

Going a step further, I used the description box that is accessible from the ships name, to give back story, details of the craft, and even failure to launch/flight accidents log. Getting really into this surprisingly, I thought maybe others might be interested in it, being that I seem to be enjoying creating it so much. I thought about playing some, and than maybe writing a bit of a story with how Professor Boone makes his journey into "Blue Heaven" and what he does there.

Anyone think this sounds like something they would enjoy?
Yeah, could be worth a try. Interesting to have just leaving the atmosphere as a challenge.
